page.title: 13Clowes Wood (continued)
page.content: Today, the trees are about 80 years old, they are largely deciduous but some conifers have been planted to give shade. The woods contain an area of "wet meadow", which was farmed until 1940 ,when it became neglected and trees grew.Today, it has been cleared and the grass is cut for hay.Wild flowers such as cowslips now grow there.There is also an area of "heath land" which was damaged by the steam trains travelling through and burning the heather. Today, this has been cleared and there are now heathers and bilberries growing.There are a variety of wild flowers to be found including Lily of the Valley, wild honeysuckle,carawheat etc. The pond contains many insects and plants. Mudtrack,deer,squirrels,shrew,moles, weasels etc:can be found happily surviving in this environment.
